section_title: Gauge Unification and the Standard Model
summary: Section 5 focuses on gauge unification within the SO(10) GUT framework emerging from TCS G₂ geometry. Key predictions include the GUT scale M_GUT = 2.118×10¹⁶ GeV, unified coupling α_GUT = 1/23.54, and proton lifetime τ_p = 8.15×10³⁴ years with geometric suppression. The Pati-Salam breaking chain is geometrically preferred, and doublet-triplet splitting is resolved natively via topological filtering.

formulas.label: (5.3) GUT Scale

html_source.context: The grand unification scale emerges from the G₂ volume

steps: Start with 4D Planck mass: M_Pl = 2.435×10¹⁸ GeV
G₂ volume: Vol(G₂) = V_G₂ · ℓ_P⁷ where V_G₂ is dimensionless
Kaluza-Klein relation: M_GUT = M_Pl × (Vol(G₂)/ℓ_P⁷)^(-1/2)
Effective torsion correction: multiply by exp(|T_ω|) where T_ω = -1.0

formulas.notes: Complete in config.py with terms defined. Formula ID is 'gut-scale' (label incorrectly shows 4.2 in config, should be 5.3). Needs derivation steps added.

formulas.label: (5.2) GUT Coupling

html_source.context: The GUT coupling is derived from geometry using the 10π factor. This matches the experimental unification value 1/α_GUT ≈ 24.3 to within 0.8%.

steps: SO(10) gauge kinetic function: f_GUT ∝ Vol(Σ_sing)/Vol(G₂)
10π factor from SO(10) normalization and Bianchi identity
Torsion correction: exp(|T_ω|/h^{1,1}) where T_ω = -1.0, h^{1,1} = 4
Volume ratio from TCS geometry: Vol(Σ_sing)/Vol(G₂) ≈ 0.75

testability.experimental_comparison: 1/α_GUT ≈ 24.3 (RG evolution of SM couplings to unification)
testability.status: Excellent agreement with experimental unification point

formulas.notes: Complete formula with all terms. Needs derivation steps. Simulation file validates RG evolution.

formulas.label: (5.1) SO(10) Breaking Chain

html_source.context: The Standard Model gauge group emerges from D5 singularities in the G₂ geometry

formulas.notes: Complete theoretical formula. Shows GUT embedding of SM gauge group.

formulas.label: (5.3a) Pati-Salam Breaking Chain

current_config.html: SO(10) → SU(4)<sub>C</sub> × SU(2)<sub>L</sub> × SU(2)<sub>R</sub> → SU(3)<sub>C</sub> × SU(2)<sub>L</sub> × U(1)<sub>Y</sub>

html_source.context: The Pati-Salam breaking chain is geometrically preferred within the TCS G₂ framework. Intermediate Pati-Salam scale M_PS = 1.2 × 10¹² GeV.

steps: SO(24,2) bulk symmetry contains SO(10) GUT group as maximal compact subgroup
G₂ holonomy projection favors maximal intermediate subgroup SU(4)_C × SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R
54_H Pneuma condensate ⟨Ψ_P⟩ aligns with 7D internal curvature of TCS manifold
G₂ curvature tensor selects Pati-Salam direction: R_ijkl proportional to SU(4)_C generators
Intermediate scale: M_PS = 1.2 × 10¹² GeV from volume stabilization hierarchy

formulas.notes: Complete with derivation showing geometric preference for Pati-Salam over other breaking chains (e.g., flipped SU(5)).

formulas.label: (5.4c) Doublet-Triplet Splitting

current_config.html: N<sub>doublets</sub> - N<sub>triplets</sub> = ∫<sub>M</sub> Â(M) ∧ ch(L<sub>Y</sub>) mod ℤ₂
current_config.plain_text: N_doublets - N_triplets = ∫_M Â(M) ∧ ch(L_Y) mod Z₂

html_source.context: The splitting is enforced by an Atiyah-Singer index theorem on the G₂ manifold. The doublet-triplet splitting mechanism requires b₂ ≥ rank(G_SM) = 4. The TCS manifold saturates this bound with b₂ = 4 exactly.

higgs_decomposition.context: Higgs multiplet decomposition under SM gauge group

topological_filter.context: Shadow Z₂ acts as topological filter projecting triplets to shadow sector

steps: TCS topology: b₂ = 4 from K3 × K3 × T² building blocks (Corti et al. 2015)
Shadow Z₂ symmetry: Acts as topological filter on Higgs 10-plet decomposition
Topological projection: Triplets 3_C mapped to shadow sector, topologically disconnected from 4D
Index theorem: ∫_M Â ∧ ch(L_Y) = 3 mod 2 (three doublet zero-modes)
Triplet projection: Not at GUT scale, but topologically absent from observable sector
Doublet mass: m_h = 125.1 GeV (radiatively stable from Higgs quartic)

formulas.notes: Complete index theorem formula. Native TCS topological filter mechanism (NOT Wilson lines) - parameter-free resolution of doublet-triplet splitting problem. Critical for proton decay suppression.

formulas.label: (5.5) Weak Mixing Angle

html_source.context: The weak mixing angle at M_Z from SO(10) breaking

steps: SO(10) prediction at GUT scale: sin²θ_W = 3/8 = 0.375
RG evolution from M_GUT = 2.12 × 10¹⁶ GeV to M_Z = 91.2 GeV
Two-loop beta functions reduce value to 0.231
Threshold corrections at GUT scale: Δsin²θ_W = +0.0002

formulas.notes: Complete prediction with derivation in HTML. Excellent experimental agreement (0.33σ).

formulas.label: (5.5a) Electromagnetic Fine Structure at M_Z

html_source.context: The electromagnetic coupling at the Z-pole is derived from gauge coupling unification

steps: Electroweak relation: α_em = α₂ sin²θ_W (at tree level)
Using sin²θ_W(M_Z) = 0.23121 and α₂⁻¹(M_Z) = 29.6 from RG evolution
Calculate: α_em⁻¹ = α₂⁻¹/sin²θ_W = 29.6/0.23121 = 128.0
With threshold corrections: α_em⁻¹(M_Z) = 127.9

terms.α₂⁻¹(M_Z): SU(2)_L coupling inverse = 29.6 from RG evolution

steps: Electroweak relation: α_em = α₂ sin²θ_W (at tree level)
Using sin²θ_W(M_Z) = 0.23121 and α₂⁻¹(M_Z) = 29.6 from RG evolution
Calculate: α_em⁻¹ = α₂⁻¹/sin²θ_W = 29.6/0.23121 = 128.0
With threshold corrections: α_em⁻¹(M_Z) = 127.9

formulas.notes: NEW FORMULA to add to config.py. Important cross-check of gauge unification consistency.

formulas.label: (5.6a) Higgs Scalar Potential

html_source.context: Standard Higgs potential. Minimization gives v_EW = 246 GeV and m_h = √(2λ)v_EW = 125 GeV

formulas.notes: Complete established formula with standard electroweak symmetry breaking.

formulas.label: (5.6b) Higgs Quartic Coupling

html_source.context: The UV Higgs quartic coupling λ₀ at the GUT scale derives from the gauge couplings

steps: At GUT scale: g₁ = g₂ = g₃ = g_GUT = √(4πα_GUT) ≈ 0.73
D-term potential: V_D = (1/8)(g₂² + g₁'²)|H|⁴ where g₁' = √(3/5) g₁
GUT normalization: λ₀ = (1/4)(g₂² + (3/5)g₁²) = (8πα_GUT/5) × (5/4) = 2πα_GUT
With α_GUT = 0.0425: λ₀ = 2π × 0.0425 = 0.267 (tree-level)
Including top Yukawa threshold: λ₀ ≈ 0.129 (at M_GUT)
derivation_html.experimental: RG evolution to M_Z gives λ(M_Z) ≈ 0.13, yielding m_h = √(2λ)v = 125 GeV

formulas.notes: Complete formula. Note: HTML shows λ₀ at GUT scale, config shows λ(M_Z). Both are present in different contexts.

formulas.label: (5.7) XY Gauge Boson Decomposition

html_source.equation: $$\mathbf{45}_{\text{SO}(10)} = \underbrace{(\mathbf{8},1)_0}_{\text{8 gluons}} + \underbrace{(1,\mathbf{3})_0}_{\text{3 weak}} + \underbrace{(1,1)_0}_{\text{1 hypercharge}} + \underbrace{(\mathbf{3},2)_{+5/6}}_{\text{6 X}} + \underbrace{(\bar{\mathbf{3}},2)_{-5/6}}_{\text{6 } \bar{X}} + \underbrace{(\mathbf{3},2)_{-1/6}}_{\text{6 Y}} + \underbrace{(\bar{\mathbf{3}},2)_{+1/6}}_{\text{6 } \bar{Y}} + \underbrace{\text{9 neutrals}}_{\text{heavy}}$$
html_source.context: The SO(10) adjoint representation contains 45 gauge bosons. X and Y bosons mediate proton decay. X bosons (12 total): Color triplet, weak doublet, charge ±4/3. Y bosons (12 total): Color triplet, weak doublet, charge ±1/3. Masses: M_X = M_Y = M_GUT = 2.118×10¹⁶ GeV

recommended_addition.label: (5.7) XY Gauge Boson Decomposition
recommended_addition.description: SO(10) gauge boson decomposition under SM gauge group, showing X and Y bosons

terms.9 neutrals: Heavy neutral bosons at GUT scale

recommended_addition.notes: X and Y bosons mediate baryon number violation (proton decay). M_X = M_Y = M_GUT = 2.118×10¹⁶ GeV

formulas.notes: NEW FORMULA to add to config.py. Critical for understanding proton decay mechanism.

formulas.label: (5.8) Proton Decay Operator

html_source.context: XY bosons mediate baryon number violation through dimension-6 operators

steps: Gauge boson count: 45 = 8 + 3 + 1 + 12 + 12 + 9 (gluons + weak + hypercharge + X + Y + neutral)
X boson mediation: p → e⁺ π⁰ (dominant channel)
Y boson mediation: p → ν̄ π⁺ (subdominant)
Decay rate: Γ_p ∝ (α_GUT² m_p⁵)/(M_X⁴) × S⁻¹ where S is geometric suppression
With M_X = 2.118 × 10¹⁶ GeV and S = 2.125 (from TCS geometry): τ_p = 8.15 × 10³⁴ years
derivation_html.experimental: Super-K limit: τ_p > 1.67 × 10³⁴ years (90% CL) — PM prediction is 4.9× the bound

recommended_addition.label: (5.8) Proton Decay Dimension-6 Operator
recommended_addition.html: O<sub>6</sub> = (g<sub>GUT</sub>²/M<sub>X</sub>²) ε<sup>abc</sup> ε<sup>ij</sup> (u<sub>a</sub><sup>c</sup> γ<sub>μ</sub> d<sub>b</sub>)(Q<sub>ci</sub> γ<sup>μ</sup> L<sub>j</sub>)
recommended_addition.plain_text: O₆ = (g_GUT²/M_X²) εᵃᵇᶜ εⁱʲ (uₐᶜ γ_μ dᵦ)(Q_ci γ^μ L_j)
recommended_addition.description: Dimension-6 operator for proton decay mediated by X,Y gauge bosons

steps: X boson exchange: p → e⁺ π⁰ (dominant channel)
Y boson exchange: p → ν̄ π⁺ (subdominant)
Integrating out heavy X,Y bosons gives dimension-6 operator
Coefficient: g_GUT²/M_X² where M_X = M_GUT
Decay rate: Γ_p ∝ (α_GUT² m_p⁵)/(M_X⁴) × S⁻¹

recommended_addition.notes: Critical operator for proton decay. Dominant contribution from X boson exchange.

formulas.notes: NEW FORMULA to add to config.py. Foundation for proton decay calculation.

formulas.label: (5.9) Geometric Selection Rule for Proton Decay

html_source.context: The proton decay rate is suppressed by a geometric selection rule arising from spatial separation of matter and Higgs fields on distinct 3-cycles in the TCS G₂ manifold (Acharya 2008; Friedmann & Witten 2003; Corti et al. 2015). d is the geodesic distance between cycles and R is the characteristic radius of the G₂ manifold.

steps: TCS neck structure: Matter fields localize on associative 3-cycles in the compact region
Higgs localization: Higgs fields localize on separate 3-cycles in the asymptotic K3 × T² ends
K = 4 matching condition: Four fibres connect the compact region to the asymptotic ends
Geodesic separation: d/R = ln(K)/(2π) = ln(4)/(2π) ≈ 0.12
Suppression factor: S = exp(2π d/R) = exp(2π × 0.12) = e^0.75 ≈ 2.1
derivation_html.note: This is a topologically fixed parameter with zero variance — no tuning freedom

recommended_addition.label: (5.9) Geometric Selection Rule
recommended_addition.description: Geometric suppression of proton decay from cycle separation in TCS G₂

terms.d: Geodesic distance between matter and Higgs 3-cycles

steps: TCS neck structure: Matter fields localize on associative 3-cycles in compact region
Higgs localization: Higgs fields localize on separate 3-cycles in asymptotic K3 × T² ends
K = 4 matching condition: Four fibres connect compact region to asymptotic ends
Geodesic separation: d/R = ln(K)/(2π) = ln(4)/(2π) ≈ 0.12
Suppression factor: S = exp(2π d/R) = exp(0.75) ≈ 2.125 (topologically fixed)

recommended_addition.notes: Topologically fixed with ZERO variance. No free parameters. References: Acharya 2008; Friedmann & Witten 2003; Corti et al. 2015

formulas.notes: NEW FORMULA to add to config.py. Critical geometric suppression factor for proton lifetime.

formulas.label: (5.10) Proton Lifetime

html_source.context: The complete proton lifetime formula incorporates the geometric suppression. C = 3.82 × 10³³ yr is the QCD matrix element factor.

steps: GUT coupling from Section 5.2: α_GUT = 1/23.54 = 0.0425
GUT scale from Section 5.3: M_GUT = 2.118 × 10¹⁶ GeV
Geometric suppression: S = exp(2π × 0.12) = 2.125 (topologically fixed)
With geometric suppression: τ_p = τ₀ × S = 3.83 × 10³⁴ × 2.125 = 8.15 × 10³⁴ yr
derivation_html.experimental: Super-K limit: τ_p > 1.67 × 10³⁴ years (90% CL) — PM prediction is 4.9× the bound

testability.status: Falsifiable prediction - within reach of next-generation experiments

formulas.notes: Formula exists but needs update to match HTML version (eq 5.10) which includes QCD factor C explicitly. Current config has S² but HTML has S. Derivation needs enhancement with complete uncertainty analysis.

formulas.label: (5.11) Threshold Corrections

html_source.context: Precision gauge unification requires threshold corrections from heavy Kaluza-Klein states and moduli-dependent string loop effects

steps: Kähler moduli: h^{1,1} = 4 contributes to gauge kinetic function
KK scale: M_* ~ 5 TeV (first Kaluza-Klein excitations)
Winding modes: Subdominant at M_string ~ 10¹⁷ GeV
Group-theoretic coefficients: k₃ = 3, k₂ = 2, k₁ = 1 (SU(3), SU(2), U(1))
Net effect: Δsin²θ_W ≈ +0.0002 (improves unification)
derivation_html.simulation: See simulations/threshold_corrections.py for full CY4 moduli treatment
